designations.source: A review of the status of Larger Brachycera flies of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Larger Brachycera flies last undertaken in 1991, using a more modern IUCN methodology for assessing threat
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: Since its discovery in 1979, Chrysopilus erythrophthalmus has been found widely in Britain although considering that it is a moderately conspicuous species, there are still few records. It has been recorded in 12 hectads since 1990. It does appear to be rare and probably has a low density. Its well defined habitat is widespread in Britain but is susceptible to damage by agricultural enrichment and pesticides. Moved beyond NR under Criteria 2 and 7.
